They typically drop older leaves that are becoming less efficient at photosynthesis - it's like they're doing their own cost-benefit analysis. "Is this leaf giving me more energy than it's costing me to maintain?" Lower leaves often get less light anyway, so the plant redirects resources to the newer, better-positioned leaves.
